medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Onset of epigastric pain occurred at 1 PM on the day of presentation, which lasted for 1 day. The patient describes regular gallbladder attacks occurring 3 hours after eating, lasting 1.5 hours, sharp in nature, usually associated with emesis. This episode started an hour after eating and persisted without associated emesis. Symptoms first started in early ___, occurred twice monthly with varying intensity, improving until ___. Pain typically radiates to the back, lasts hours. Pain was ___ on this occasion but less severe than typical episodes.
